p: Time-series sampling of patients can capture the dynamic nature of disease over time and highlight the biological changes that occur as disease progresses. Previous longitudinal studies of COVID-19 have primarily focused on the immune response against pathogens [ 4, 5]. At present, sequencing-based multiscale changes among critical COVID-19 patients and their potential correlation with clinical trajectory remain unknown. Exploration of these molecular changes could contribute to our understanding of COVID-19 and help uncover potential therapeutic targets. Many studies have shown that comorbidities impact the COVID-19 prognosis [ 6, 7]. Therefore, we studied patients without selected comorbidities (see Methods).
